{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3499272,"name":"","username":"mrEkko","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mrekko/{size}/262783_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-01T20:59:53.327Z","cooked":"

Greetings!

I am working on a shuffleboard widget POC. Following the documentation and examples in the shuffleboard repository, I have created my plugin widget, FXML, custom data, custom data type, and the sendable object in the robot’s code. These can be found at the following links:

  • Sendable implementation
  • Custom plugin/widget

The widget itself seems to work as expected. I can interact with each of the UI elements and the data backing the widget seems to be properly updated, however the data from the widget is never being published back to network tables, and therefore the robot-side is never getting the updated data from the widget.

Using a breakpoint on line 54 of the sendable, I confirmed that manually changing the published NT value using OutlineViewer does trigger the breakpoint and update the robot data, and also the widget updates itself accordingly as well at that time. It seems like it’s only the Shuffleboard → NT publishing that’s broken.

Can someone familiar with Shuffleboard widgets take a look and provide direction?

This is almost certainly the same issue as Shuffleboard inputs no longer working

We don’t yet know what the root cause is, and no one is actively working on a fix. If you’re willing to dig deeper into the code to figure out what’s going on, help would be welcome! It was probably introduced by PR 807, but that’s a very large change to revert.

Thanks for the heads up. Makes me feel better to know it’s not something I missed. Unfortunately, my lack of JavaFX experience is not up to the task of digging deeper, and I’d hate to accidentally re-introduce the high CPU usage fixed by PR 807.

Judging by this comment, it seems my efforts would be better spent on getting a similar widget working with Elastic.

What does your widget look like/do? I would be more than happy to assist you in adding it to QFRCDashboard.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-02-01T22:06:52.858Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":40,"readers_count":39,"score":13.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":484703,"topic_slug":"publishing-data-to-nt-from-shuffleboard-widget","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":31300,"username":"mrEkko","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mrekko/{size}/262783_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50684,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6032 | QDash"},"post_url":"/t/publishing-data-to-nt-from-shuffleboard-widget/484703/4","custom_user_title":"6032 | QDash","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3499514,"name":"","username":"mrEkko","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mrekko/{size}/262783_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-02T00:31:03.859Z","cooked":"

The widget allowed the user to choose from a list of paths/commands sent from the robot to assemble a sequential list of tasks which would form a single autonomous routine.

The intent was to provide a quick and easy way for the drive team to assemble autonomous routines on a per-match basis, since there is a plethora of combinations of starting locations, scoring locations, and reload locations possible in Reefscape, and creating a PathPlanner Auto for every single permutation would be incredibly time consuming. It would also add improved versatility with other teams’ auto modes, if we suspected that our chosen routine could impact another alliance member.

The data backing widget this would be PathPlanner paths for each “piece” of a potential auto routine (such as Start1-to-ReefAB or ReefAB-to-FloorCoral1) and a list of named commands that could be added in between paths (such as ScoreCoralLeftL3). As the drive team adds steps to the routine, the list would be synced between the robot and the dashboard so that, on Autonomous start, the robot can build a sequential command from the routine steps and run it.

Limitations on the choices were also built into the widget to ensure that the first step in the routine would always be a starting location path, and subsequent steps must either be a command, or a path that begins where the last path left off, to keep the list of choices for the drive team as focused as possible.

I realize this is potentially a niche, game-specific widget, so if it’s more effort than it’s worth I understand. This was a POC and I’m not positive how well the system would have worked in practice.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-02-02T00:31:03.859Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":35,"readers_count":34,"score":12.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":484703,"topic_slug":"publishing-data-to-nt-from-shuffleboard-widget","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":50684,"username":"crueter","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/crueter/{size}/258043_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":31300,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/publishing-data-to-nt-from-shuffleboard-widget/484703/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3499518,"name":"","username":"crueter","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/crueter/{size}/258043_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-02T00:34:39.663Z","cooked":"
mrEkko:

I realize this is potentially a niche, game-specific widget

I already added a reef display widget so this isn’t an issue for me. I could potentially see this being useful in future games regardless.

I’ll get to work on this within the next week, I have a few higher priority things to do at the moment.

Just a heads up, no rush on this.

I was able to get similar functionality working by extending a SendableChooser so that items could be removed/cleared, and adding the option logic and state in a class on the robot-side.
